name: Json.Schema
comment:
This library provides bunch of utility methods to work with JSON values using
schemas defined in JSON Schema format.

Currently it allows to construct schemata (draft-6), validate values and generate random
values based on schema (very experimental feature).
It supports local references, but doesn't support remote references.

# Decode schema

Use `fromValue` or `fromString` methods if you receive schema from external source. If you want to construct schema from elm code you might want to use `Json.Schema.Builder`, or low-level API using definitions from `Json.Schema.Definitions`

@docs fromValue, fromString

# Validation

@docs validateValue

values.name: fromValue
values.comment: Construct JSON Schema from JSON value

values.name: validateValue
values.comment: Validate value against JSON Schema. Returns True Result if case if object is valid, or string error otherwise.

name: Json.Schema.Builder

types.name: SchemaBuilder
types.comment:
Builder for JSON schema providing an API like this:

    buildSchema
        |> withTitle "My object"
        |> withProperties
            [ ( "foo"
              , buildSchema
                    |> withType "string" )
            , ( "bar"
              , buildSchema
                    |> withType "integer"
                    |> withMaximum 10
              )
            ]
cases: { errors : List String , schema : Maybe.Maybe Json.Schema.Definitions.SubSchema , bool : Maybe.Maybe Bool }

values.name: buildSchema
values.comment: Create schema builder with blank schema

values.name: encode
values.comment: Encode schema into a builder code (elm)

values.name: toSchema
values.comment: Extract JSON Schema from the builder

values.name: validate
values.comment: Validate value using schema controlled by builder.

values.name: withContains
values.comment:
Set the `contains` property of JSON schema to a sub-schema.

    buildSchema
        |> withContains
            (buildSchema
                |> withType "string"
            )

values.name: withNullableType
values.comment:
Set the `type` property of JSON schema to a nullable type.

    buildSchema
        |> withNullableType "string"

values.name: withType
values.comment:
Set the `type` property of JSON schema to a specific type, accepts strings

    buildSchema
        |> withType "boolean"

values.name: withUnionType
values.comment:
Set the `type` property of JSON schema to an union type.

    buildSchema
        |> withUnionType [ "string", "object" ]

name: Json.Schema.Definitions

aliases.name: SubSchema
aliases.comment: This object holds all draft-6 schema properties
aliases.type: { type_ : Json.Schema.Definitions.Type , id : Maybe.Maybe String , ref : Maybe.Maybe String , title : Maybe.Maybe String , description : Maybe.Maybe String , default : Maybe.Maybe Json.Decode.Value , examples : Maybe.Maybe (List Json.Decode.Value) , definitions : Maybe.Maybe Json.Schema.Definitions.Schemata , multipleOf : Maybe.Maybe Float , maximum : Maybe.Maybe Float , exclusiveMaximum : Maybe.Maybe Float , minimum : Maybe.Maybe Float , exclusiveMinimum : Maybe.Maybe Float , maxLength : Maybe.Maybe Int , minLength : Maybe.Maybe Int , pattern : Maybe.Maybe String , format : Maybe.Maybe String , items : Json.Schema.Definitions.Items , additionalItems : Maybe.Maybe Json.Schema.Definitions.Schema , maxItems : Maybe.Maybe Int , minItems : Maybe.Maybe Int , uniqueItems : Maybe.Maybe Bool , contains : Maybe.Maybe Json.Schema.Definitions.Schema , maxProperties : Maybe.Maybe Int , minProperties : Maybe.Maybe Int , required : Maybe.Maybe (List String) , properties : Maybe.Maybe Json.Schema.Definitions.Schemata , patternProperties : Maybe.Maybe Json.Schema.Definitions.Schemata , additionalProperties : Maybe.Maybe Json.Schema.Definitions.Schema , dependencies : List ( String, Json.Schema.Definitions.Dependency ) , propertyNames : Maybe.Maybe Json.Schema.Definitions.Schema , enum : Maybe.Maybe (List Json.Decode.Value) , const : Maybe.Maybe Json.Decode.Value , allOf : Maybe.Maybe (List Json.Schema.Definitions.Schema) , anyOf : Maybe.Maybe (List Json.Schema.Definitions.Schema) , oneOf : Maybe.Maybe (List Json.Schema.Definitions.Schema) , not : Maybe.Maybe Json.Schema.Definitions.Schema }

types.name: Schema
types.comment: Schema can be either boolean or actual object containing validation and meta properties

types.name: Schemata
types.comment: List of schema-properties used in properties, definitions and patternProperties

types.name: Type
types.comment: Type property in json schema can be a single type or array of them, this type definition wraps up this complexity, also it introduces concept of nullable type, which is array of "null" type and a single type speaking JSON schema language, but also a useful concept to treat it separately from list of types.

values.name: stringToType
values.comment:
Attempt to parse string into a single type, it recognises the following list of types:
- integer
- number
- string
- boolean
- array
- object
- null
